Description: Simple fine handmade hemispherical bowl in Nile clay with curving sides, simple rim and flat base. Worn interior belly. Covered in red slip and pebble-burnished, with stripes of polishing running horizontally on exterior and vertically on interior.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p17)
